attributes.action: Create a separate loan that caters for accommodation for university students
attributes.background: Many student loans barely cover the cost of accommodation, so how will students from low income families go to the university of their choice when accommodation is more than the loan they are entitled to? This leaves many students in a deficit before they've even paid for anything.
attributes.additional_details: With an extra loan that caters for accommodation students will not have debt on their shoulders as soon as they start university, and can start focusing on more important things like the education itself. If grants are scrapped, at least bring something new and realistic to the table? This way less students will be tied between going to university or not because of the expenses, and will have easier access to a higher education letting students from 'low income families' have a better chance.

attributes.action: To introduce lessons on taxation and British law into the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that as a student who will soon be making the change to university life hopefully, I and many others are under prepared for adult life. I also believe that it is vital children know their rights as a British citizen and also the basic laws of Britain.

attributes.action: Introduce realistic maximum time for DBS applications for people trying to work.
attributes.background: DBS disclosures are needed to protect vulnerable people, yet thousands of people with families are waiting months to start a job they have been offered. This causes detrimental effects to peoples health and well being and in some cases homelessness.
attributes.additional_details:
These stresses and strains caused to peoples livelihoods need to be dramatically reduced. Many people are waiting over 5 months (in some cases over 7) uncertain of when they can financially support themselves and their families.
Many applications made to the DBS are for roles within the health and social care sector, increasingly under pressure through lack of staff. 
The government should also consider that such delays in peoples wages also directly impacts upon income tax payments.

attributes.action: Petrol stations must offer the option to purchase fuel with a CO2 offset eg +1p
attributes.background: Driving my car contributes to global warming because burning fuel produces CO2. I would happily choose to pay an extra penny or so to offset my carbon, for example, by planting a tree. We will empower every driver to make a difference and show that Britain can lead the world in CO2 reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
It is very difficult for ordinary people to reduce the amount of CO2 that they produce. I have to heat my house in winter, drive to work and I like to go on holiday somewhere warm. Although I can reduce my consumption a bit, I can't reduce it enough to make a difference on my own. However if I work with other people I can make a difference.

 "Carbon offsetting" allows me to pay other people to reduce their CO2 emissions and "offset" my own. Here are some examples of offsetting projects https://www.bptargetneutral.com/uk/our-projects/a-global-portfolio/

attributes.action: Exemption of the 3% tax levy on parents helping their children to buy a home.
attributes.background: Helping children to buy homes should not be taxed. The money being used by parents has already been taxed twice as salary and as savings. This law is morally corrupt.

attributes.action: Stop increasing the pension age.  Reverse it back to 62 and 67 now.
attributes.background: Action is urgently required.  there are few of us who feel able to work in their late 60's/mid 70's especially if their jobs have been stressful or physical.  Just how are we supposed to keep going and who is going to employ us.  Reverse this increase back to 62 and 67 now

attributes.action: Ban real animal fur from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Animals are being cruelly killed for their skin. These animals include; elephants, salt water crocs, snakes, foxes, wolves. 
The super rich including rappers, pop stars buy these skins in the form of coats, handbags and trainers. Some of these animals are skinned alive.
attributes.additional_details: Reggie yates documentary, Kim Kardashian

attributes.action: Make an INDEPENDENT EU booklet - facts, figures, forecasts if we STAY + if we GO
attributes.background: The EU Referendum is producing a blizzard of numbers, claims, guesses - it is virtually impossible for voters to assess properly the facts as they stand, or to get a balanced set of forecasts on the implications of either result. Without this information, the public cannot be asked to make a choice.
attributes.additional_details:
An independently produced booklet, perhaps no bigger the governments already produced booklet on why we should vote to stay, can be quickly produced to present first the facts as they stand and then the general expert views on what are the implications for the country if we vote to stay and if we vote to go.
Without giving voters a proper opportunity to assess both the facts and the body of opinion for both options in order to make their informed choice, we undermine democracy itself.

attributes.action: Ban diesel fuel! We deserve cleaner air.
attributes.background: Diesel fuel is slowly killing us. Let's get rid of it and live healthier, longer lives.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/apr/21/all-top-selling-cars-break-emissions-limits-in-real-world-tests

attributes.action: Ban smoking outside pubs,restaurants and cafes to make a smoke-free Britain
attributes.background: We need to ban this because when people like to sit outside a restaurant in the summer if they do not smoke they do not want anyone smoking outside when they are eating the food.
attributes.additional_details: when you are just coming  in the a pub you do not want people outside smoking when you come you mind not want to go in the pub at the end.

attributes.action: stop medicines wastage, allow the re-use of returned medication to the  pharmacy
attributes.background: Every year millions of pounds is lost when medications are returned to the pharmacy for destruction by patients, care homes e.t.c. Some of the medication remains untouched. We have the ridiculous situation where medication that has left the premises and returned the next day has to be destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow pharmaceutical bodies to have criteria which can be followed to allow some medication that has to be returned to pharmacies to be re-used thus saving millions of pounds firstly in destruction costs and secondly in the cost of the medication. In light of the recent financial crisis and the cash strapped NHS. These efficiency savings could be pumped back into the NHS. It is also and unethical scenario when there are people around the globe who cannot afford medications.

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed tax on individual landlords with mortgages
attributes.background: I have worked all my life and  do not have a pension (like George Osbourne), I bought a small property for the future so I wont be a burden on the state.
attributes.additional_details: I know everyone will think all landlords are rich but we simply are not Im just trying to provide an income for when I retire in about ten years and don't think I should be punished for this.

attributes.action: Make all military veterans pensions tax free after a minimum service period
attributes.background: All veterans currently pay income tax on their pensions after full active military service i.e 22 years.  This is then classed as a second income, and other job income taxed accordingly.

attributes.action: Support farmers,pay rural farm payments on time.
attributes.background: This badly organised system has caused suicide within the farming community,disrupting cash flow.
attributes.additional_details: Payment on time: farmers are the salt of the earth:why do we have to suffer, the worry of not being able to pay our debts,last minute decision to inform us: no information as to when payments will be made.Try to get any answers is impossible:

attributes.action: Force all motorcycle delivery riders to pass a full UK motorcycle driving test
attributes.background: Most delivery motorcycle riders are riding on L Plates. i.e. they have not passed a full motorcycle driving test. Their standard of riding is poor and they pose a high risk to other road users/pedestrians. They are using the roads for commercial purposes, they should be forced to pass a driving test

attributes.action: All police forces and MPs have drug tests every 3 months
attributes.background: Both parties hold high responsibility jobs, If the public can be penalised for it, then so can police forces and MPs, what's good for the goose is good for the gander

attributes.action: Scrap the £9000 tuiton fees!
attributes.background: Students on majority of course are now forced to pay £9000 a year to go and study for their career, a 3/4 year course leaves students with £36,000 debt before their career has even started! Lets fight against this! Many student do even get theres moneys worth or the services they paid for.
attributes.additional_details: The fees for university were £1000 in 1998...how times have changed how can you justify £9000 today?

attributes.action: Make anyone who claims benefits do a few hours of community service a day
attributes.background: Anyone who claims benefits because they don't work, should be made to do a few hours of community service each day. I feel this would help as they are earning the money and giving back to the community, there is no reason for people to be getting money without working for it.
attributes.additional_details: This can also give people who are unable to find work added experience towards their CV, possibly making it easier for them to find a job in the future.

attributes.action: Stop schools forcing children to pray and sing religious songs in assembly.
attributes.background: It is not fair that children, in Primary Schools especially are forced to sing religious songs, hear biblical stories and say prayer in morning assemblies. Even if children are allowed to sit out (e.g. because they have different beliefs) that is encouraging isolation based on religion.

attributes.action: Reject the PM's deal: put an option in the referendum to demand a democratic EU.
attributes.background: The PM's deal makes the EU nor more democratic and returns no sovereignty to the 28 states. We must be able to elect EU legislators and executive and be able to remove them. Others of the 28 states within the EU are demanding more democracy and an end to the secret deals struck between bureaucrats.
attributes.additional_details: You might see the DiEM25 site (http://diem25.org) and read some of Yanis Veroufakis' posts for some informative data.  It is not necessary to agree with the solutions, but only to understand the problems.

attributes.action: Revise the Protection from Harassment Act 1997
attributes.background:
The harassment Act is one incredibly washy piece of legislation which allows the Police to apply the act to almost any situation. 

There is clearly a need & public interest in preventing harassment especially where violence or a threat of violence is involved. 
It is not proportionate at present
attributes.additional_details:
The act needs to exempt online and digital communications as there is clearly technology to get around this contact.
The act needs to allow for non threatening contact and not criminalise civil disputes.

attributes.action: By LAW, owners of micro-chipped pets change the details as with a car log book.
attributes.background: Too many owners are getting away with animal abuse. They are stating, when RSPCA/ police knock on their door, they "sold it on" or "only bred it". Therefore responsibility has gone. A car is a lump of metal but people are fined if the log book is not changed over to the new owner.
attributes.additional_details: Therefore responsibility has gone. A car is a lump of metal but people are fined if the log book is not changed over to the new owner. The same law needs to be applied to chipped pets. If you sell/give away a pet then you are responsible for obtaining the new owners details, the same as selling a car on. If not, YOU are liable.  Proof of address is all is needed, passport etc. It is not hard! This now needs to be the next stage in making people responsible for their pets and liable if any harm comes to them if you have not taken the correct steps when your pet goes to a new home.  This WILL stop further animal abuse.

attributes.action: Apprenticeships; Stop loss of child related benefits for low income families.
attributes.background: The search for my future career has come to me and I was searching for options for my post 16 education. One option that came to mind was an apprenticeship. However, being from a low income family it soon became apparent that there were great financial implications rendering me unable to do one.
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices even though they are classed as in training they are no longer classed as 'dependants' for child tax credit and child benefit reasons thus leaving families a shortfall of in some cases upward of £80; a sum of which families below a certain income cannot afford to loose.

attributes.action: EU referendum vote only to be valid when turnout is 66% (2015 general election)
attributes.background: On Thursday 23rd June the United Kingdom will be voting to decide whether to stay in a 'reformed' European Union or leave. This is the biggest decision of a generation (far beyond a single government). It's only right that a required turn out be the same as the previous general election (2 thirds).
attributes.additional_details: The 'average person' currently does not necessary know the importance of staying or leaving and the effects it may have on them should we stay or leave. Therefore with such a major decision it's paramount that as a nation overall, votes are a fair sample. Not the majority of people who wanted to call the referendum in the first place to leave.

attributes.action: Move Parliament to a central UK location during building repairs at Westminster.
attributes.background: London-centric investment and thinking dominates at the expense of the rest of the UK. The political establishment, and the nation, would benefit immensely from having a more geographically central view point, if only temporarily for the duration of Houses of Parliament building works.
attributes.additional_details:
Renovating the Houses of Parliament with Commons and Lords in occupation will be costly beyond belief.
Historically Parliament often moved.
Germany has coped well with moving the Bundestag first to Bonn, and then back to Berlin.
Today's (16 February 2016) news of the closing of Bede's World museum in Jarrow is just the latest indication of the dominance of London and the South East and the reinforcement of the North-South divide.

attributes.action: Make ministers do work experience in all the jobs covered by their departments.
attributes.background: People who actually do the work - eg: teaching, fishing, being creative - have real insight into what works and what doesn't work. Let's our ministers that hands on experience and set of real relationships.  Then perhaps they would make wiser policy decisions which work with people and our values.
attributes.additional_details: I work supporting people with learning disabilities and their families.  Government financial policy is undermining our ability to support people properly giving them dignity and human rights.  I believe that any MP who worked with people would appreciate the positive inspiration they are to others and see people as a gift not a cost.  In other sectors the whole sense of what is important and of value would change.  Our leaders would lead from lived experience rather than mental guesses.

attributes.action: Let's keep personal data personal
attributes.background: I'd like to stop all companies from using my personal details or information collected about me for any other purpose than to deliver the service I asked for.
attributes.additional_details:
Mandatory opt out of this type of information sharing should be UK law unless a customer explicitly opts in.

The Information Commissioner must have extensive powers to deal with any breaches and large companies must be mandated to provide clear and transparent information outlining how much of this type of information they hold, how many customers have explicitly opted in (records to be kept), who they share information with and details of any money that has exchanged hands as a result.

attributes.action: Improve the salary and working conditions of Junior Doctors
attributes.background: The NHS is under threat because the current government does not appropriately recognise the needs of Junior Doctors

attributes.action: Compulsory Annual Fitness Bleep test for Members Of Parliament.
attributes.background: Recent introduction of Police Compulsory Fitness Bleep testing should naturally extend to the governing bodies the Houses Of Parliament in the order of Transparency and Equality. I offer to extend the Government's own introduction to incorporate the Members Of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Recent introduction of Police Compulsory Fitness Bleep testing should naturally extend to the governing bodies the Houses Of Parliament in the order of Transparency and Equality. I offer to extend the Government's own introduction to incorporate the Members Of Parliament.

attributes.action: Make law/part of MOT high viz vests first aid kit and fire extinguisher in cars.
attributes.background: It should be law and part of the MOT that every car should carry high visibility vests 1 per seat as well as a first aid kit and fire extinguisher. Also that no matter what time of the day or night if you break down you must wear the vest. Might just save quite a few lives even one.

attributes.action: Seek an EU deal where migrant worker benefit costs are met by their home state.
attributes.background: David Cameron should change tack on his negotiation with the EU over EU-migrant benefits and push for a deal which allows the free movement of workers, a core EU principle, but stipulates that the cost of any benefits for those workers be paid for by the state from which that person originates.
attributes.additional_details: e.g. a Polish worker in the UK would be entitled to benefits under Polish and UK law, but would be paid for by the Polish state. Likewise any UK person living in Spain, for example, who is entitled to claim benefits would have the cost of those met by the UK government.

attributes.action: Add suicide prevention cages around all bridges to reduce suicides
attributes.background: By building cages or fences around bridges, people who are wanting to end their lives will be deterred by the uneasiness of jumping from a bridge. Although this does not help with other ways of ending their lives, other lives will not be taken when they land on a car, killing the family inside it.

attributes.action: Increase the severity of young offenders punishments
attributes.background: We are a campaigning group wanting to change the way u18 criminals are punished. We think that if young offenders serve a short amount of time in a prison environment with other offenders of the same stature, they will realise and understand the consequences that will come if they keep on offending.
attributes.additional_details: SCE- stop crime early educational pressure group We only want to keep the youth offenders in the prison environment for a short amount of time, because results have shown the longer people remain in imprisonment, they start to think it is normal and no longer a punishment that would make them change their ways. Sentences would alter on the severity of the crime, and after they have done their time it will be compulsory to attend some sort of service such as cadets or helping the community.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum 10 year jail sentence for anyone carrying a knife
attributes.background: I believe there is a minimum sentence for people convicted of carrying a knife,  or being involved in knife crime,  but it seems this is not implemented strictly enough.  As a result we are hearing of stabbing on an almost daily basis.  More needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details:
Bringing in a minimum 10 year jail sentence for anyone caught carrying a knife will act as a tough deterrent and may make people think about the consequences.  Bringing in a minimum jail term for anyone involved in knife crime, even being with someone carrying a knife,  will be a deterrent for gangs to congregate together in groups and will be less likely to go through with any knife attack without a large gang egging people on.  

More needs to be done 

Please sign my petition if you agree

attributes.action: Ensure the full payment of corporation tax on sales generated in the UK
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon the Chancellor of the Exchequer, to pilot legislation through Parliament that ensures for every pound raised in sales by any company in the United Kingdom, twenty pence is sent direct to the Treasury by means of corporation tax.

attributes.action: Introduce education on abusive relationships to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: 77% of young people claim that they do not have access to information on healthy and abusive relationships. By introducing education on abusive relationships to the National Curriculum, abuse and intimate partner violence could be prevented- saving the UK millions and reducing death rates.
attributes.additional_details: There is a shameful stigma and a culture of misinformation surrounding abuse. Seeing that education is the way forward, giving our youth the chance to learn about something that touches on the life of 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men could be crucial to achieving equality and saving lives.

attributes.action: Amend the public Smoking Ban of 2007
attributes.background: Since the 1st July 2007, smoking has been banned in all public places throughout the country. Devastating the social lives of millions. Pubs, Clubs, Bingo Halls and Cafe's have been hit hardest. Changing the law to allow separate smoking rooms would repair financial and social crises.
attributes.additional_details:
Smokers have been torpedoed out onto the streets of Britain. Social lives ruined, the working mans club fading, pubs closing every day and Bingo Halls becoming less popular. We are living in a modern country and rather than encourage isolation, we should be encouraging the opposite. 
Amend the ban for, 
Pubs
Clubs (Social, Working Mens)
Bingo Halls
Cafe's & Coffee Shops. 
We are living in the 21st Century where technology is on the up, ventilation is the key. We need the return of smoking rooms, before it's too late!!

attributes.action: Subsidise membership to gyms, leisure centres & sport clubs to reduce UK obesity
attributes.background: In the UK, obesity is a major problem. Both care for obesity and related illness such as heart, liver or intestinal disease costs the NHS now close to £50 billion and this needs to stop. The cost of keeping fit prevents people being able to be healthy and thus I propose subsidising access to fitness
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2007 overweight and obesity care (both directly and indirectly) cost the NHS over £5.1bn in that one year. 
- Obesity is now, according to a recent report, is costing the country nearly £47,000,000,000 a year. 
- In the past 9 years that is an 821% increase and now obesity is a greater burden on the UK’s economy than armed violence, war and terrorism. The study, conducted by McKinsey & Company, also reveals obesity is the 2nd largest impact on the UK economy... generating an annual loss equivalent to 3% of GDP.

attributes.action: The British government to commit 1% of GDP to ending third world poverty.
attributes.background: We all respond to appeals for emergency aid when disaster strikes, but the major problem remains for the Third World because of our greed in the developed world.

attributes.action: Introduce incentives for every building to install Solar panels.
attributes.background: The Government should make a real economic investment for the future of the UK's energy security by giving real economic incentives for every home, business, factory, school in the UK to have Solar panels fitted.
attributes.additional_details:
If every home, business, factory, school had Solar panels.
1) They would generate much of their own electrical needs
2) Excess energy goes into the national grid reducing the need for more power stations
3) Gives the UK the biggest renewable power station
4) Ensures the future energy security of the UK
5) Would greatly cut greenhouse emission
6) Makes the UK a world leader in renewable energy and Green

attributes.action: Make carbon monoxide alarms compulsory in social housing accommodation
attributes.background: Carbon monoxide poisoning sends 4,000 people to A&E each year and leads to 50 deaths every year in the UK. From 1st October 2015 regulations require both smoke and carbon monoxide alarms to be installed in rented residential accommodation. There is an exemption for providers of social housing.
attributes.additional_details: Carbon monoxide (CO) is an odorless, invisible, and tasteless poisonous gas and continuous inhalation can be fatal. Carbon monoxide can be produced by incomplete burning of carbon-based fuels, including gas, oil, wood and coal. This could be caused by faulty or poorly maintained appliances. Having a carbon monoxide alarm installed serves as an early warning sign if any CO is leaking into your home. Just like a smoke alarm it can save lives early. Make this a necessity for all UK homes.

attributes.action: Instigate a root & branch review of The FA
attributes.background: Following the dismal performances of the senior England football team in the European Championships it is time for an effective review of The FA and in particular the senior England set up.
attributes.additional_details: Having failed to qualify for the European championships in 2008 a root and branch review was allegedly carried out. This has clearly had no long lasting effect on the organisation and this  petition is to request that Tracey Crouch MP, Minister for Sport brings pressure upon the FA to carry out a full review of the circumstances surrounding the failings during this championship. This should include selection of inappropriate squad players.

attributes.action: Referendum to choose between negotiated IN and OUT EU plans
attributes.background: On 23rd June the British Electorate was given a choice between remaining in the EU or something else. We did not know what that alternative was. We should give the people of the UK a proper choice between two concrete negotiated plans for our future either in or out of the EU before leaving.

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Repeal Scotland Act 1998 and 2016 Amendments and dissolve Holyrood
attributes.background: On 26th June First Minister Nicola Sturgeon threatened to veto UK succession from the EU despite the country voting by over 1.2 million votes to leave. Such action is in contravention to democratic will. Westminster should reverse Scottish devolution to prevent the SNP's constitutional overreach

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: Make petrol tax cheaper for sports car drivers
attributes.background: Because driving and running costs are already a lot. Petrol shouldn't be over priced so people can't drive how they want to drive Thierry performance cars

attributes.action: Petition for a referendum to decide on a 2nd British referendum on EU membership
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a referendum to decide on whether another EU referendum will take place. If the yes vote is more than 60%, then a second EU referendum, also with a 60% majority threshold requirement for the winning side, should be held.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland, Gibraltar, & possibly NI to inherit EU membership if they choose
attributes.background: That the UK voted to Leave whilst 1 territory and 2 nations voted to Remain poses obvious constitutional questions. The government should address those as a democracy, and offer apt constitutional arrangements (eg Scottish independence; others are more complex) which allow them to stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK's Brexit negotiations should allow polities to opt-out and inherit EU membership.

This avoids a gap between losing EU membership within the UK and regaining it under Article 49 accession.

Democracy (not Scottish nationalism) demands a referendum in Scotland.

New constitutional paths should be explored for Gibraltar and Northern Ireland that respect their links to UK, economic ties to EU and (esp NI) complex politics. 

Any changes should coincide with (and depend on) Brexit.

attributes.action: Set a date for a Scotland independence referendum
attributes.background: The U.K. Eu referendum result is not supported by the majority in Scotland. A further referendum should be run to determine if Scotland wishes to remain in Europe.
